Articles.Content:
Back in the Depression, we ate meat loaf made of racoon and saw dust. And we played KSP. That's all there was to do. There was no work to be had. So we played KSP until FDR got off his Rough Rider ass and gave us some jorbs.

0.00.000
im here before the GREAT forum collapse ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I joined in 0.25 if i remember correctly ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I came at 0.18.5

> 
> I came at 0.18.5

Is that a typo? There was no 0.18.5.

About a week before the 0.23 update hit. I had the demo for all of ten minutes before I threw my debit card at Squad for the full version. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

0.23 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[10 chars!)
I came in last year, just a day before 0.23

> 
> I came at 0.18.5

Wait, There isn't an 0.18.5.

> 
> Is that a typo? There was no 0.18.5.

sorry, I think it was 0.18.2?
I joined at .18 I think. Watching videos of old ksp makes me realise how far the game has come.

I joined around .23 I believe, because I think the first update I got was the one before SP+. Also, I got into it from Kurtjmac ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I follow him and other Mindcrackers and I had seen a few KSP videos around so it looked interesting, and I fell in love with it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I first started playing the game back in 0.13.2, but I quickly fell victim to the black hole that is blowing stuff up and then forgetting about the game. I then came back to KSP just after 0.18 was released upon realizing how much more content there was. I've been playing ever since ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

NOTE: Looking at the poll there's a really interesting pattern showing. Perhaps 0.18 was the peak of the game's popularity, or perhaps that's just the average for forum users.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-28T14:57:29Z" title="02/28/2015 02:57  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 28, 2015</time> by HatBat**

.23.5 I started playing around late March or early April (demo).

But I never played version .24 because of mods...

> 
> NOTE: Looking at the poll there's a really interesting pattern showing. Perhaps 0.18 was the peak of the game's popularity, or perhaps that's just the average for forum users.

Well, my guess would be that a lot of people are in my boat; I had heard of KSP a few times, but I didn't really learn about it or buy it until it launched on Steam, which was version .19 (well, I think .19.1 but that's not on the poll).

Steam launch was March 21, 2013. I bought it the next day. Registered a forum account several days after that. Forum account got wiped in the big snafu less than a month later. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Didn't bother re-registering for quite some time.

I think I joined it 0.19 which I think was a the spike in media coverage. I remember seeing it all over the internet while I was looking for a new game and this seemed right up my alley. 300 hours later here I am still going.
I joined the day the demo switched from 0.13.3 to 0.18.3. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
0.13.3 technically, but I bought the game at 0.16. Man, that was such a cool version of the game.
I got started with KSP originally with the 0.13.3 demo version and bought it a couple weeks later, not long after the 0.16 release
0.10 person here, circa 2011. Took hiatus on the way (0.14, 0.18, then 0.25)

[something]

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-05T04:04:17Z" title="04/05/2015 04:04  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 5, 2015</time> by Jack Wolfe**

I remember playing the demo for only a few days before I bought it, and I just checked my account which says I bought it August 2012. When I get home from work I'll check to see the oldest version I have saved, but I want to say it's 0.16. I do remember it was before the planets were added.
0.14, but didn't achieve much before 0.15.
.18.2, back in December 2012. I was instantly hooked after playing the demo.
0.23.5, although I spent a while on the demo so it might have been 0.23.
